entry.title: The Materials and Articles in Contact with Food (Scotland) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke the Materials and Articles in Contact with Food (Scotland) Regulations (S.S.I. 2005/243) (“the 2005 Regulations”) and re enact or re enact with amendments provisions contained in those Regulations. These Regulations provide for the enforcement of Regulation (EC) No. 1935/2004 of the European Parliament and of the Council on materials and articles intended to come into contact with food and repealing Directives 80/590/EEC and 89/109/EEC (O.J. No. L 338, 13.11.04, p.4) (“Regulation 1935/2004”).

entry.title: The Magistrates’ Courts Warrants (Specifications of Provisions) (Amendment) Order 2007
entry.summary: Sections 125A to 125D of the Magistrates’ Courts Act 1980, as inserted by section 92, 93, 94 and 96 of the Access to Justice Act 1999, make provision for the enforcement of warrants issued under statutory provisions specified by order. This Order amends the Magistrates’ Courts Warrants (Specification of Provisions) Order 2000 which specifies such provisions.

entry.title: The Income Tax (Benefits Received by Former Owner of Property) (Election for Inheritance Tax Treatment) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations are made pursuant to Schedule 15 to the Finance Act 2004.

entry.title: The Renewables Obligation (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2007
entry.summary: The Renewables Obligation Order (Northern Ireland) 2007 (“the 2007 Order”) imposes an obligation (“the renewables obligation”) on all electricity suppliers who are licensed under the Electricity (Northern Ireland) Order 1992 to supply to customers in Northern Ireland specified amounts of electricity from renewable sources. As alternatives, in respect of all or part of an electricity supplier’s renewables obligation, the supplier is permitted to provide evidence that other licensed electricity suppliers have supplied electricity generated using renewable sources instead of it or to make payment to the Northern Ireland Authority for Utility Regulation (“the Authority”). Renewable sources include wind, water, solar and biomass.

entry.title: The Housing (Scotland) Act 2006 (Consequential Amendments) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order makes amendments to 5 statutory instruments to replace references to “rent assessment panel” and “rent assessment committee” with “private rented housing panel” and “private rented housing committee” respectively. The amendments are consequential upon section 21 of the Housing (Scotland) Act 2006 (asp 1), which makes provision for the names of the panel and committee.

entry.title: The Civil Aviation (Contributions to the Air Travel Trust) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under section 71A of the Civil Aviation Act 1982, which authorises the Secretary of State to make provision for persons applying for licences under section 71 of that Act to make contributions to the Air Travel Trust.

entry.title: The Import and Export Restrictions (Foot-and-Mouth Disease) (Scotland) (No. 5) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and re-make with amendments the Import and Export Restrictions (Foot-and-Mouth Disease) (Scotland) (No. 4) Regulations 2007.

entry.title: The Police and Justice Act 2006 (Commencement No. 5) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order brings into force in Wales section 22 of and Schedule 9 to the Police and Justice Act 2006.

entry.title: The Student Fees (Amounts) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Student Fees (Amounts) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005 (“the 2005 Regulations”) by increasing the basic and higher amounts prescribed in the 2005 Regulations. The amendments come into operation on 1st September 2008.

title.div: The Bluetongue (Wales) (Amendment) Order 2007 / Gorchymyn y Tafod Glas (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2007

div.p: This Order amends the Bluetongue (Wales) Order 2003, S.I 2003/326 (W.47) (“the 2003 Order”), which implements Council Directive 2000/75 laying down specific provisions for the control and eradication of bluetongue (OJ No L327, 22.12.2000, p 74).

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn diwygio Gorchymyn y Tafod Glas (Cymru) 2003, O.S. 2003/326 (Cy.47) (“Gorchymyn 2003”), sy'n gweithredu Cyfarwyddeb y Cyngor 2000/75 sy'n gosod darpariaethau penodol ar reoli a difa'r tafod glas (y dafod las) (OJ Rhif L327, 22.12.2000, t. 74).

entry.title: The Licensing (Scotland) Act 2005 (Commencement No. 4) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order brings certain specified provisions of the Licensing (Scotland) Act 2005 into force on 1st February 2008 (article 2 and Schedules 1 and 2). So far as not already in force, that Act is brought into force at 5.00 a.m. on 1st September 2009 (article 3).

entry.title: The Import and Export Restrictions (Foot-and-Mouth Disease) (No.5) (Wales) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and re-make with amendments the Import and Export Restrictions (Foot-and-Mouth Disease) (No.4) (Wales) Regulations 2007. The principal amendment allows the export of certain ovine and caprine semen and embryos (regulation 10(2)), and introduces new certification requirements for those products. The Regulations implement Commission Decision 2007/663/EC (O.J No. L270, 13.10.2007, p. 21) amending Decision 2007/554/EC concerning certain protection measures against foot-and-mouth disease in the United Kingdom.

entry.title: The Bluetongue (Compensation) Order 2007
entry.summary: This Order makes provision for compensation to be paid in respect of an animal affected with, suspected of being affected with, or exposed to the infection of, bluetongue slaughtered under section 32 of the Animal Health Act 1981 (c. 22). The amount of compensation is the market value of the animal immediately before it is slaughtered, had it not been so affected, suspected of being affected or exposed to infection.

entry.title: The Motor Vehicles (Compulsory Insurance) (Information Centre and Compensation Body) (Amendment) Regulations 2007
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Motor Vehicles (Compulsory Insurance) (Information Centre and Compensation Body) Regulations 2003 by omitting the definition of “guarantee fund”, an expression which is not used elsewhere in the Regulations, from regulation 2(1). A full regulatory impact assessment has not been produced for this instrument as no impact on the private or voluntary sectors is foreseen.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Proceedings in the Sheriff Court under the Debtors (Scotland) Act 1987) Amendment (Vulnerable Witnesses (Scotland) Act 2004) 2007
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt amends the rules of procedure in the sheriff court for proceedings under the Debtors (Scotland) Act 1987. It extends the powers of the sheriff under the rules to include the powers held by the sheriff under Chapter 45 of the Ordinary Cause Rules in the First Schedule of the Sheriff Courts (Scotland) Act 1907 in dealing with vulnerable witnesses within the meaning of the Vulnerable Witnesses (Scotland) Act 2004 (“the 2004 Act”).

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Sheriff Court Bankruptcy Rules 1996) Amendment (Vulnerable Witnesses (Scotland) Act 2004) 2007
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt amends the Sheriff Court Bankruptcy Rules 1996. It gives the sheriff the same powers to deal with applications in relation to vulnerable witnesses and the special measures that may be ordered in relation to vulnerable witnesses within the meaning of the Vulnerable Witnesses (Scotland) Act 2004 (“the 2004 Act”) that are held by the sheriff under Chapter 45 of the Ordinary Cause Rules in the First Schedule to the Sheriff Courts (Scotland) Act 1907.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Sheriff Court Company Insolvency Rules 1986) Amendment (Vulnerable Witnesses (Scotland) Act 2004) 2007
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt amends the Sheriff Court Company Insolvency Rules 1986. It gives the sheriff the same powers to deal with applications in relation to vulnerable witnesses and the special measures that may be ordered in relation to vulnerable witnesses within the meaning of the Vulnerable Witnesses (Scotland) Act 2004 (“the 2004 Act”) that are held by the sheriff under Chapter 45 of the Ordinary Cause Rules in the First Schedule to the Sheriff Courts (Scotland) Act 1907.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Chancery Procedure Rules 2006) Amendment (Vulnerable Witnesses (Scotland) Act 2004) 2007
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt amends the Chancery Procedure Rules 2006. It gives the sheriff the same powers to deal with applications in relation to vulnerable witnesses, and the special measures that may be ordered in relation to vulnerable witnesses within the meaning of the Vulnerable Witnesses (Scotland) Act 2004 (“the 2004 Act”), that are held by the sheriff under Chapter 45 of the Ordinary Cause Rules in the First Schedule to the Sheriff Courts (Scotland) Act 1907.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Debt Arrangement and Attachment (Scotland) Act 2002) Amendment (Vulnerable Witnesses (Scotland) Act 2004) 2007
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt amends the rules of procedure for applications in the sheriff court under the Debt Arrangement and Attachment (Scotland) Act 2002. It gives the sheriff the same powers to deal with applications in relation to vulnerable witnesses and the special measures that may be ordered in relation to vulnerable witnesses within the meaning of the Vulnerable Witnesses (Scotland) Act 2004 (“the 2004 Act”) that are held by the sheriff under Chapter 45 of the Ordinary Cause Rules in the First Schedule of the Sheriff Courts (Scotland) Act 1907.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Child Care and Maintenance Rules 1997) Amendment (Vulnerable Witnesses (Scotland) Act 2004) 2007
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt amends the Act of Sederunt (Child Care and Maintenance Rules) 1997 (“the 1997 Rules”) to give the sheriff the same powers to deal with applications in relation to vulnerable witnesses and the special measures that may be ordered in relation to vulnerable witnesses within the meaning of the Vulnerable Witnesses (Scotland) Act 2004 (“the 2004 Act”) that are held by the sheriff under Chapter 45 of the Ordinary Cause Rules in the First Schedule to the Sheriff Courts (Scotland) Act 1907. These powers apply to all hearings under the 1997 Rules, except those hearings where rules in relation to vulnerable witnesses already apply under Part XI of Chapter 3 of the 1997 Rules.
